test_question_testing_A.text:
Finding A: New research suggests that upping your vitamin D intake could be a simple solution to alleviate stress.
Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and A for most sensational.
Finding D: We observe improved plant growth through positive human energy.

Computer_Science_tweet_5_r$Computer_Scie.text:
Finding A: Researchers say 120,000 deaths a yr may be from stress related to the way U.S. companies manage their work forces:\n
Finding B: The researchers found that people remember information better if it is presented to them in a virtual environment.
Finding C: While their vastly superior London knowledge distinguished them, an examination of grey matter volume in the brains of taxi drivers revealed further differences.
Finding D: Finally, professionals in the Western region of the United States were less accepting of mobile phone use during meetings.

Computer_Science_444_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: The study described in this paper focuses on gaze, but similar approaches can be used to understand the effects of other interactions that contribute to patient outcomes such as emotion.
Finding B: "Here we have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive deep brain stimulation," said Dr. Starr.
Finding C: Women showed far less acceptance for the use of mobile phones during informal meetings.
Finding D: Relatively few accounts are responsible for a large share of the traffic that carries misinformation.

Computer_Science_36_p$Computer_Science_3.text:
Finding A: showed that children observing physical towers in a mixed-reality game learned physics principles better and showed higher levels of enjoyment compared to students interacting with a solely virtual game on a laptop .
Finding B: As the checked baggage fee policy gets implemented from zero to one to two bags, the scheduled block time increases.
Finding C: "Here we have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive deep brain stimulation," said Dr. Starr.
Finding D: Competition between groups increases creativity in groups composed of men. Has opposite effect of female groups

Finding A: A foam tube wrapped with a skin was able to inch forward like a worm.
Finding B: Roughly 71% of the professionals said they would not make a call or take a call during a meeting.
Finding C: Note that, although for large networks such high computational cost makes this solution often unfeasible, for criminal networks constituted (most often) by hundreds or at most thousands of nodes, this algorithm works well.
Finding D: The program states can include all desired experimental protocols for the implant.

Computer_Science_465_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: That makes the microswimmer ever more robust and flexible than others.
Finding B: Also, professionals from the Southwest were less likely to be accepting of mobile phone use during informal meetings.
Finding C: In both patients there were energy savings without worsening of clinical symptoms.
Finding D: The overall improvement from pre to post was 11.3 % in the mixed-reality conditions and 2.4 % in the virtual conditions.

Computer_Science_tweet_2_r$Computer_Scie.text:
Finding A: "Metabolic cost of walking explained by combination of 4 costs—swing & torso dynamics, COM velocity redirection, ground clearance, and body weight support. Overall energetic cost depends on how these separable components tradeoff and manifest under different walking conditions."
Finding B: We are less sure about a possible explanation for lower acceptance for mobile phone behaviors among professionals in the West.
Finding C: In summary, our social robot, Minnie, demonstrates the potential for transforming reading at home from an isolated activity into a social and collaborative experience that can promote comprehension and interest in reading.
Finding D: Our results supported Hypothesis \uf6dc, that markers of depression are observable in Instagram user behavior, and Hypothesis \uf63a, that these depressive signals are detectable in posts made even before the date of first diagnosis.
Computer_Science_tweet_2_r$Computer_Scie.displayed_text:
Finding A: "Metabolic cost of walking explained by combination of 4 costs—swing & torso dynamics, COM velocity redirection, ground clearance, and body weight support. Overall energetic cost depends on how these separable components tradeoff and manifest under different walking conditions."
Finding B: We are less sure about a possible explanation for lower acceptance for mobile phone behaviors among professionals in the West.
Finding C: In summary, our social robot, Minnie, demonstrates the potential for transforming reading at home from an isolated activity into a social and collaborative experience that can promote comprehension and interest in reading.
Finding D: Our results supported Hypothesis \uf6dc, that markers of depression are observable in Instagram user behavior, and Hypothesis \uf63a, that these depressive signals are detectable in posts made even before the date of first diagnosis.

Computer_Science_tweet_19_p$Computer_Sci.text:
Finding A: We prove that constant-depth quantum circuits are more powerful than their classical counterparts.
Finding B: Notably, activations in the medial orbitofrontal region and the anterior cingulate cortex, relevant for self-referential appraisal and aesthetic judgments, could be predicted successfully.
Finding C: The researchers found that people remember information better if it is presented to them in a virtual environment.
Finding D: The benefits of forecasting Beyond helping people plan their weekends, ecological forecasts will improve decision-making in agriculture, forestry, fisheries and other industries.

Computer_Science_108_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag.
Finding B: In other words, taxi drivers had plumper memory centers than their peers.
Finding C: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding D: Men were nearly twice as likely as women to consider mobile phone use at a business lunch acceptable.

Computer_Science_409_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: A decrease in posterior network degree and an increase in the clustering coefficient in frontal regions suggests changes in long-range communications that allow for corticocortical interactions between networks and may be related to cognitive impairments associated with cannabis use.
Finding B: Changes in communication between the brain\'s cortical areas could also be related to cognitive impairments correlated with cannabis use.
Finding C: Interesting approach for targeting food inspections
Finding D: These navigational demands stimulate brain development, concludes a study five years in the making.
